description: Borrowed from Latin nuncupātus, past participle of nuncupō (“pronounce, name as heir”), contraction of nōmen (“name”) and capiō (“take, seize”).

verbs.description: nuncupate (third-person singular simple present nuncupates, present participle nuncupating, simple past and past participle nuncupated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, law) To declare, usually of a will, by word of mouth only.
